thread.title: Insurers Gaming Surprise Bill Arbitrator Selection, Surgeons Say

author: Lauren Clason
title: Insurers Gaming Surprise Bill Arbitrator Selection, Surgeons Say
text: A New York neurosurgery practice is suing the Biden administration alleging that health plans are abusing the process for selecting an arbitrator when settling disputes over surprise medical bills. The [case](https://www.bloomberglaw.com/public/document/NeurologicalSurgeryPracticeofLongIslandPLLCDocketNo224cv04503EDNY?doc_id=X3BSRVFE7KA9R9RLALN9M1201SO) filed Thursday in New York federal court raises an issue that appears novel in the ongoing legal battles over the enforcement of the 2020 No Surprises Act, which requires medical providers and insurance companies to resolve billing disputes for unexpected out-of-network care, shielding the patient from surprise bills.
